metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0240 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The mod_wsgi module before 3.5 for Apache, when daemon mode is enabled, does not properly handle error codes returned by setuid when run on certain Linux kernels, which allows local users to gain privileges via vectors related to the number of running processes.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0240` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-wsgi - 3.4-4ubuntu2.1.14.04.1
libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 - 3.4-4ubuntu2.1.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> from upstream: The issue is believed to affect Linux systems running kernel versions >= 2.6.0 and < 3.1.0.

criterions.comment: mod-wsgi package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4-4ubuntu2.1.14.04.1').
